entry.title: Re: Understanding the Integration of SAP Environment, Hea...
entry.content:
That's a great and very important question. Avoiding data silos is the fundamental design principle behind SAP S/4HANA for Environment, Health, and Safety.

The core of our strategy is an ‚ÄòERP-centric‚Äô approach, which means EHS is not a separate bolt-on but is woven into your core business processes and runs on the same SAP S/4HANA platform. This creates a multi-dimensional integration across processes and data. In practice, this means:

  1. Shared Master Data: EHS leverages the same master data for materials, assets, and people that your other departments use, ensuring a single source of truth.
  2. Integrated Processes: EHS events can trigger actions in other modules. For example, an incident investigation can directly create a maintenance notification in Asset Management to fix faulty equipment, or an identified training need can be pushed to SAP SuccessFactors.
  3. Connected Reporting: Data flows seamlessly. For instance, calculated emissions from Environment Management feed directly into SAP Sustainability Control Tower for accurate and auditable corporate ESG reporting.

In short, the integration prevents EHS from becoming an 'island' by connecting safety and environmental operations directly to your asset management, HR, and sustainability strategies.

I hope this helps!!

entry.title: Initial Setup of SAP Document AI, Embedded Edition & Workspace
entry.content:
The SAP Document AI solution helps you process large numbers of business documents containing a wide variety of content and structures. After you upload a document file to SAP Document AI, it extracts data across different sections and layouts, regardless of how the information is organized within the document.

With SAP Document AI, embedded edition, you can access the following AI features:

  1. SAP Document AI, embedded edition
  2. SAP Document AI workspace

For more details about AI features & usage metrics on SAP Document AI, embedded edition, please refer to our Discovery Center pages.

Let us now understand how to subscribe to SAP Document AI, embedded_edition plan

Please keep a note of following prerequisites before activating the SAP Document AI, embedded_edition plan:

  1. Access to SAP BTP Global Account as global account administrator
  2. Subaccount with Cloud Foundry enabled
  3. Check if you have additional tenant (service plan) of SAP Cloud Identity Services (SIS) tenant active. To check existing SIS tenants associated with your organization, you can use this LINK.
  4. Establish Trust with the subaccount created where you would be activating the SAP Document AI solution.

 

Procedure to subscribe:

1. Login to your BTP Cockpit and navigate to the subaccount where you would like to activate the service (in this case - Document AI ‚Äì Embedded edition is our subaccount). To understand how to create a subaccount, follow this document.

2. Click on Entitlements to add the service to the Document AI ‚Äì Embedded edition subaccount.

  Click Edit and Add Service Plans

 

3. Add required service plan for SAP Document AI. Search for the service in search bar and select the embedded_edition plan among the other.  To subscribe to the new UI, select the default (Application).

Click on Add 2 Service Plans

4. After adding the services, please Save the changes.

 5. Go to Overview and click on Enable Cloud Foundry (this is one of the prerequisites to activate SAP Document AI)

While enabling Cloud Foundry, you will see below fields pre-filled. You can choose to change them as per your preference. Once you fill these details, click on Create.

You can Create Space and name it dev for development environment. Find out more about Cloud Foundry and Spaces.

 6. Navigate to Service Marketplace to activate the service.

 7. First, let‚Äôs create an instance for SAP Document AI, embedded_edition.

After selecting embedded_edition plan, you can select Cloud Foundry as Runtime Environment and choose dev as the Space. You can name the instance as per your preference. Click on Create, this will create the instance.

We will follow the same steps to subscribe to the new UI (Workspace) of SAP Document AI.

Before that, you will have to establish trust with your subaccount using your Cloud Identity Services tenant. Please follow the steps mentioned in this document to establish trust.

After establishing trust, subscribe to the Workspace as follows:

This is how your Instances and Subscriptions would look like after executing above steps successfully:

8. In order to access the Workspace, you will have to assign Authorization Policy in your SAP Cloud Identity Services tenant.Start by signing into the administration console for SAP Cloud Identity Services. This is how the home page would look like:

 9. Under Applications & Resources, choose the Applications tile.

Choose your application that supports authorization management and select Authorization Policies. You should be able to see all the roles available for the SAP Document AI solution, which you can assign to your users as per your requirements.

10. You can either choose which roles to assign to which user in your organization. Here, we will only try to assign the Admin role. Select Admin and click on Add to assign your user to this role.

Select the User and click on Add to assign Admin role.

 11. After successfully adding user, navigate back to your BTP Cockpit, under Instances and Subscriptions, click on the Actions button (3 dots) and Go to Application.

12. The logon screen appears. Enter your Identity Authentication service Email or User Name and Password to log on.

13. You may receive a pop up as below before signing in. Do not panic, just click on here and you will be redirected to the Workspace UI.

 

This is how your Workspace UI would look like after successful login.

 

Hope these steps are helpful for you to get started with SAP Document AI, embedded edition.

Enjoy the process while exploring the new features. Please check this document to understand more about the features embedded in the workspace.

Happy learning!

 

Best Regards,

Medha Patki | SAP BTP Onboarding Advisor

Customer Services & Delivery

entry.title: Reimagining Logistics for the Cloud Era ‚Äî Inside SAP Logistics Management
entry.content:
Many small and mid-sized companies still depend on siloed systems: an old WMS here, spreadsheets for transportation, and emails for carrier updates. The result? Disconnected visibility, inefficiency, and rising logistics cost.

SAP Logistics Management (LGM) reimagines this landscape.
Built natively on the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), LGM unifies warehousing, transportation, and network collaboration into a single intelligent cloud platform. It brings the power of SAP EWM, SAP TM, and SAP Business Network for Logistics (BN4L) together for the first time in a cloud-native experience.

Solution Overview ‚Äî Unified, Scalable, and Built for the Cloud

SAP Logistics Management bridges execution gaps by bringing every logistics function into a unified flow: from goods receipt to shipment confirmation, across multiple warehouses, modes, and carriers.

Source: 4577_SAP_Logistics_Management_L2_Public

Key Design Principles

Principle Description
Cloud-nativeSaaS architecture, auto-updates, minimal IT footprint.
Unified logistics layerIntegrates warehouse, transport, and carrier collaboration.
AI-enabledEmbedded Joule AI assistant supports planning and exception handling.
Network-readyPre-integrated with SAP Business Network for Logistics.
Composable & scalableAdopt modules progressively (start small, scale fast).

Functional Scope ‚Äî From Warehouse to Network

SAP LGM delivers four main functional pillars:

  1. Warehouse Logistics (cloud EWM capabilities)

  2. Transportation Logistics (cloud TM capabilities)

  3. Network Collaboration (integrated with BN4L)

  4. Unified Planning & Control (real-time visibility cockpit)

Each pillar comes with its own set of Fiori apps, use cases, and business value.

Warehouse Logistics ‚Äî Cloud EWM Simplified

Warehouse Logistics in LGM handles end-to-end inbound, internal, and outbound warehouse operations. Designed for ease of adoption, it provides structured receiving, storage, and dispatch processes with mobile execution and embedded analytics ‚Äî all running in the cloud.

Category Capabilities Business Benefit

InboundGoods receipt, putaway, inspectionReduce manual errors and waiting time.
InternalBin management, replenishmentOptimize space and movement.
OutboundPicking, packing, staging, loadingFaster fulfillment accuracy.
MobileScanning & task confirmationReal-time execution; paperless workflow.
MonitoringDashboards & alertsImprove supervisory visibility.

Warehouse Monitor App: Imagine a retailer‚Äôs regional warehouse receiving 200 SKUs per day. The supervisor uses Warehouse Monitor to see that Putaway Zone B is overloaded while Zone C is idle. Within seconds, tasks are rebalanced to maintain service levels ‚Äî no need for spreadsheets.

Key Fiori Apps in Warehouse Logistics

App Name Usage
Warehouse MonitorSupervisors track workload, resources, exceptions.
Execute Warehouse TasksOperators perform putaway/picking with handhelds.
Manage Inbound DeliveriesCreate, monitor, and post receipts for inbound deliveries.

Transportation Logistics ‚Äî Intelligent Freight Orchestration

Transportation Logistics in LGM brings planning, tendering, execution, and freight costing into one intelligent workflow. It eliminates spreadsheet-based planning and manual RFQs by integrating real-time carrier collaboration.

Category Capabilities Business Benefit
PlanningLoad building, route optimisation & consolidationCut freight costs and carbon footprint.
TenderingPeer-to-peer / broadcast to carriersAutomate carrier selection.
ExecutionFreight order tracking & event managementAchieve end-to-end visibility.
CostingFreight cost calculation & invoice reconciliationImprove financial accuracy.
AppointmentDock scheduling & time windowsReduce waiting time and idle assets.

Manage Freight RFQs App: A chemical manufacturer planning an urgent dispatch to Delhi creates an RFQ in LGM. Three carriers receive tenders instantly via BN4L; within minutes, Carrier A accepts with best price and lead time ‚Äî no emails or phone calls needed.

Key Fiori Apps in Transportation Logistics

App Name Usage
Manage Freight RFQsCreate/manage carrier RFQs.
Tender Freight OrdersPublish freight offers to carriers.
Track Freight OrdersView live shipment events & status.

Network Collaboration ‚Äî Connected by Design

Network Collaboration within SAP LGM links shippers and carriers digitally via the SAP Business Network for Logistics. It replaces emails and calls with structured collaboration ‚Äî carrier tenders, dock appointments, shipment events, and POD uploads all happen in one network workspace.

Category Capabilities Business Benefit
Carrier CollaborationTender acceptance / status updatesFaster onboarding, less manual follow-up.
Appointment SchedulingDock slot managementSmoother inbound/outbound flow.
Tracking & EventsMilestones & delay alertsPredictive visibility.
DocumentationProof of Delivery / Freight invoice sharingPaperless compliance.

Manage Carrier Collaboration App: A transport partner accepts a freight order from the shipper and uploads the signed POD once delivery is complete. The system automatically updates LGM and triggers freight invoice posting in ERP.

Key Fiori Apps in Network Collaboration

App Name Usage
Manage Carrier CollaborationDigital tender acceptance & status updates.
Schedule Dock AppointmentsDock slot coordination with carriers.
Monitor Shipment MilestonesTrack shipment events and POD status.

Unified Planning & Control ‚Äî Visibility in One View

Narrative
The Unified Planning & Control cockpit serves as the command centre for logistics execution. It integrates data from warehousing, transportation, and network collaboration into one consolidated dashboard, allowing real-time monitoring and decision-making.

Feature Description
Unified Planning ConsoleAggregate view of all logistics plans & statuses.
Control TowerMonitors execution progress and exceptions.
KPI DashboardsVisualises service levels and throughput.
Exception HandlingGuided workflows to resolve delays and errors.

Logistics Dashboard App: A distribution manager opens the dashboard each morning to view all facilities on one screen. If a lane‚Äôs OTD drops below 95 %, he drills into that carrier and sends an RFQ for replacement service ‚Äî action taken within minutes, not days.

Key Fiori Apps in Unified Planning & Control

App Name Usage
Logistics DashboardKPI overview of logistics network.
Exception Management HubCentralised issue tracking & resolution.
Dashboard for PlanningCompare planned vs actual performance.

Integration ‚Äî Seamless by Default

LGM connects to SAP Cloud ERP and SAP Business Network using standard APIs and content packages. Data flows bi-directionally for deliveries, goods movements, freight costs and invoices. This ensures a single source of truth across finance and operations.

Intelligence Layer ‚Äî Joule AI for Smarter Decisions

Joule, SAP‚Äôs AI copilot, is built into LGM. It understands context, answers in natural language, and automates common decisions like carrier selection or route replanning.

Source: 4577_SAP_Logistics_Management_L2_Public

A planner types, ‚ÄúWhich deliveries are at risk today?‚Äù Joule returns a list of orders facing delays and suggests rescheduling or alternate carriers based on historic performance. The planner approves in one click ‚Äî no manual analysis

Business Benefits ‚Äî Tangible Value for Growing Companies

Area Impact
SpeedGuided cloud deployment reduces implementation time by 50 %.
VisibilityUnified planning console gives end-to-end control.
EfficiencyAI and automation reduce manual coordination effort.
ScalabilityStart with one site or process, expand as needed.
Continuous InnovationQuarterly updates add new features without upgrades.

#SAP #SAPLogisticsManagement #SAPEWM #SAPTM #SAPBusinessNetwork #SupplyChain #CloudLogistics #AIinLogistics #Joule

entry.title: SAP MDG: Assign Roles Automatically According to CR Type
entry.content:
Hi SCN Folks, 

Hope you guys are doing great üôÇ

Note 01: This blog does not include execution screenshots.
Note 02: The entire code was developed and validated in the SANDBOX system, with results meeting expectations.
Note 03: There are several ways; this blog is written about one of them.

Create one custom class & redefine the standard class (CL_MDG_BS_ECC_HANDLER)

Method Responsible: IF_MDG_BS_BP_ACCESS_HANDLER~DERIVE_DATA

Code:

    DATA : lv_crtype      TYPE usmd_crequest_type,
           lt_bp_role     TYPE TABLE OF /mdgbp/_s_bp_pp_bp_role,
           ls_bp_role     TYPE  /mdgbp/_s_bp_pp_bp_role.

    CONSTANTS lc_crtype TYPE string VALUE 'CRTYPE'.

    DATA(obj_param) = cl_FPM_factory=>get_instance( )->mo_app_parameter.

    CALL METHOD obj_param->get_value
      EXPORTING
        iv_key   = lc_crtype
      IMPORTING
        ev_value = lv_crtype.

    READ TABLE gt_bproot_task ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_bproot_task>) INDEX 1.

    IF <ls_bproot_task> IS ASSIGNED.
      ls_bp_role-bp_header = <ls_bproot_task>-bp_id.

      CASE lv_crtype.
        WHEN 'ZMDGS01'.
          ls_bp_role-bp_rol_id ='FLVN01'.
          ls_bp_role-rol_vfrom = sy-datum.
          ls_bp_role-rol_vto = '99991231'.
          APPEND ls_bp_role TO lt_bp_role.
          ls_bp_role-bp_rol_id ='FLVN00'.
          ls_bp_role-rol_vfrom = sy-datum.
          ls_bp_role-rol_vto = '99991231'.
          APPEND ls_bp_role TO lt_bp_role.
        WHEN 'ZMDGS02'.
          ls_bp_role-bp_rol_id ='FLVN01'.
          ls_bp_role-rol_vfrom = sy-datum.
          ls_bp_role-rol_vto = '99991231'.
          APPEND ls_bp_role TO lt_bp_role.
      ENDCASE.

    ENDIF.

    io_write_data->write_data(
      i_entity     = 'BP_ROLE'
      it_data      = lt_bp_role ).

    me->if_mdg_bs_bp_access_handler~buffer_derived_data(
      io_model        =  io_model
      iv_entity       =  'BP_ROLE'
      it_data_ins     =  lt_bp_role
    ).
    .

 

SAP S/4HANA   SAP Master Data Governance   ABAP Development  

Thank You, 
Sandeep Suggu.
SAP Community Profile | SAP Profile | LinkedIn

entry.title: Bank Account derivation from IBAN via API Business Partner "A2X"
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

We are currently integrating SAP with an external system that transmits new Business Partner (Customer/Vendor Master Data) records via the "Business Partner (A2X)" API. In the source system, only the IBAN is maintained. As a result, whenever the master data includes bank details, the data distribution via API fails due to missing mandatory fields such as Bank Country, Bank Key, Bank Account, and Control Key.

Is there a way for SAP to automatically derive or calculate these fields at the time of data distribution? Alternatively, is it possible for the external source system to retrieve the necessary bank account derivation logic from SAP in advance,  prior to sending the data?

Thank you,

Erika

entry.title: üöÄ ABAP: The Language That Powers Enterprises ‚Äî And Why It Still Matters in 2025
entry.content:
Every time a purchase order gets approved, a delivery is scheduled, or an invoice is posted in SAP‚ÄîABAP is quietly doing the heavy lifting.

It‚Äôs not flashy. It‚Äôs not hyped. But it‚Äôs mission-critical.

As an SAP Consultant, I‚Äôve seen ABAP solve real business problems‚Äîautomating approvals, generating invoices, building Fiori apps. And yet, I often hear this question:

‚ÄúIs ABAP still relevant in the age of AI and Cloud? Should I learn it in 2025?‚Äù

My answer? Absolutely. Here‚Äôs why.

üß† What is ABAP?

ABAP (Advanced Business Application Programming) is SAP‚Äôs language for building enterprise applications. It‚Äôs deeply tied to business processes‚ÄîMM for materials, SD for sales, FI for finance.

Think of ABAP as business logic in motion. It‚Äôs not just code; it‚Äôs how billion-dollar companies run.

üí° Real-World ABAP Use Cases

Here are a few examples I‚Äôve worked on:

‚úÖ Approval Workflows

 

  • Scenario: Multi-level PO approvals based on value.
  • Solution: SWDD workflows + custom ABAP classes + OData for Fiori.
  • Impact: Faster approvals, audit compliance, fewer errors.

 

üìÑ Smartforms for PDF Invoicing

 

  • Scenario: Finance wants branded invoices emailed automatically.
  • Solution: Smartforms ‚Üí PDF via CONVERT_OTF ‚Üí Email with CL_BCS.
  • Impact: Professional communication, reduced manual effort.

 

üìä ALV Reports for Inventory

 

  • Scenario: Warehouse needs real-time stock visibility.
  • Solution: ALV grids with filters, totals, Excel export.
  • Impact: Better planning, fewer stockouts.

 

üîß Enhancements for Custom Logic

 

  • Scenario: Auto-fill delivery dates in sales orders.
  • Solution: BADIs or user exits.
  • Impact: Time savings, consistency.

 

üì± OData Services for Mobile Approvals

 

  • Scenario: Managers want leave approvals on mobile.
  • Solution: OData via SEGW + Fiori app.
  • Impact: Mobile productivity, faster decisions.

 

üåê ABAP + Future Tech

ABAP isn‚Äôt stuck in the past. It‚Äôs evolving:

 

  • SAP BTP: ABAP now runs in the cloud with RAP (RESTful ABAP Programming Model).
  • AI Integration: Consume AI APIs for invoice classification, predictive analytics.
  • Cloud-Native: Build apps for S/4HANA Cloud and Steampunk.

 

üí° Imagine this: An ABAP workflow that calls an AI model to predict supplier risk and auto-routes high-risk POs to senior approvers. That‚Äôs ABAP + AI + Workflow.

üõ†Ô∏è Beginner‚Äôs Roadmap

Start with:

 

  • SE11: Data Dictionary.
  • SE38/SE80: Reports ‚Üí ALV.
  • Modularization: Function modules, includes.
  • Debugging: Breakpoints, ST05, SAT.
  • Enhancements: BADIs, user exits.
  • OData & CDS: For Fiori and BTP apps.

 

üí¨ Why ABAP is Strategic

ABAP developers don‚Äôt just code‚Äîthey build systems that run global businesses. You learn how enterprises think, how processes flow, and how tech drives decisions.

Final Thought: ABAP is evolving. With S/4HANA, BTP, and Fiori, it‚Äôs more relevant than ever. If you‚Äôre looking to start a career in SAP, ABAP is your launchpad.

Follow me for more deep dives into CDS views, workflow automation, and SAP BTP‚Äîwith real code, real use cases, and real impact.

entry.title: EHS Workplace Safety: Automatic inheritance of roles across locations
entry.content:
Dear community,

I need some clarification.

I am implementing SAP S/4HANA Workplace Safety ‚Äì Health and Safety Management (On-Premise, release 2023).

In the system configuration, the following roles are set to be automatically inherited across the location hierarchy:

  • Chemical Approver
  • Chemical Requestor
  • Environmental Manager
  • Environmental Technician
  • Hazardous Substance Manager
  • Incident Manager
  • Incident Reporter
  • Safety Manager
  • Industrial Hygienist
  • Operator
  • Notification Recipient
  • Safety Data Sheet Clerk
  • Sampling Technician

However, this behavior only applies to the following roles: Environmental Manager, Environmental Technician, Incident Reporter, Safety Manager, Operator, and Sampling Technician ‚Äî these are automatically inherited from the parent company to subordinate companies and all subsequent locations.

For the following roles: Chemical Approver, Chemical Requestor, Incident Manager, Industrial Hygienist, Notification Recipient, and Safety Data Sheet Clerk, the inheritance occurs only within the same company, from higher- to lower-level locations.

For the Hazardous Substance Manager role, it must be manually assigned to the locations, as it is not inherited automatically.

Could anyone please explain why this behavior occurs?

Many thanks in advance!

entry.title: Re: RAP API with custom static action: How can I set opti...
entry.content:
Hi @Oleg_Vokh,
Thanks for your response. In order to create a behaviour, I had to change the definition of the abstract entity adding "root".

@EndUserText.label: 'Sales Report - Filters for deleteWithFilters action'
define root abstract entity ZLBSR_D_DELETION_FILTERS
{
  CustomerReference : bstkd;
  SoldToPartyGLN    : zlbstr_slsrpt_sold_to_prty_gln;
  ShipToPartyGLN    : char100;
}

Then I create the behaviour:

abstract;
strict ( 2 );
with hierarchy;

define behavior for ZLBSR_D_DELETION_FILTERS alias DeletionFilters
with control
{
  field ( mandatory : execute )

Hi @marouferchichi 

can we discuss this offline, please?

Please email or Teams chat with me: denver.fletcher@sap.com

"Intelligent attention management is the bottleneck that determines whether any business optimization system succeeds or fails. Every executive dashboard, every AI insight, every predictive model fails if it can't cut through information noise to reach decision-makers when intervention is required, and it can't unobtrusively reassure them when intervention is not required.

The Gauge transforms this fundamental constraint by converting SAP's existing mobile and alerting infrastructure into precision attention management that operates at cloud speed and scale. Rather than building new systems, we strategically adapt proven assets to enable The Forge ecosystem to deliver opportunities and engage decision-makers at machine velocity while preserving human judgment authority.

Calibration-first value: In Phase 1, The Gauge‚Äôs primary role is to make guidance calibration visible and actionable‚Äîshowing where predictions are reliable (coverage at stated PIWs) and which execution playbooks are validated. It routes fewer, higher-precision opportunities to executives, favoring digest-first delivery and role-appropriate SLAs."

entry.title: Re: Slow performance with SQL Anywhere 17 build# 7908 and 8038
entry.content:
Request logging (-zr) logs "requests" made to the engine. Any statements logged in a request log are coming from some connection. For example, SQL Central, if connected, will periodically run statements to refresh aspects of information reported in SQL Central.  You can adjust the frequency via Tools | SQL Anywhere 17 | Preferences, Automatic Refresh tab by changing  the refresh every or by deselecting the Enable Automatic refresh.

Unless you have reloaded or run a database ugrade that impacts the file format, you should not need to reload the database.  A 6399 based database will run on a newer engine without any changes. Even after running on that newer engine (provided no upgrading or rebuild), the database should be able to be run on an earlier engine (assuming both are  the same major version). 

What specifically is the problem with reloading, if you feel it is needed?

entry.title: Re: Crystal Report Suppression Logic Not Working
entry.content:
I'm not aware of a suppression logic bug in Crystal Reports.

Consider creating a formula with the suppress logic (returning True or False) and place it on the report layout.
If it returns True when you expect it to return False, investigate why.
Or post the full expression here.

entry.title: SOAP API ProductMDMBulkReplicateRequest for creating a product with classification
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We need to create products with related classifications and characteristics via API in S/4 Hana Cloud Public. For with purpose we use standard SOAP API ProductMDMBulkReplicateRequest ( https://api.sap.com/api/PRODUCTMDMBULKREPLICATEREQUEST/overview ). 

But we have a problem: when we're consuming the web service from ABAP Environment ( from custom class from Eclipse ), we get errors  in SOAP Log Message:

 

Log Messages

 
Consumer:
  • Web service processing error; more details in the web service error log on provider side (UTC timestamp 20251027114623; Transact
  • soap-env : http://schemas.xmlsoap. org/soap/envelope/
  • faultcode : soap-env:Server
  • faultstring : Web service processing error; more details in the web service error log on provider side (UTC timestamp 20251027114623; Transa ... Show More
  • lang : en
     
    Provider:
    SRT: Plain SOAP: Reliable messaging (RM) configured, but consumer sends QoS BE request.
     We are trying to call the SOAP web service within SAP: Source and Target both are S4 HANA public cloud system.

 

Here are our actions step-by-step:

1. Created a Communication User in the Maintain Communication Users app  in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition.

2. Created a communication system in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition and added as inbound communication user created in step 1

3.  Created a communication arrangement based on the communication scenario SAP_COM_0009. Deactivate all Outbound Services. And then downloaded WSDL file of Product Master - Replicate from Client to SAP S/4HANA Cloud

4. Created in ADT a service consumption model for the targeted web service from the metadata file from step 3.

5. Created in ADT  an outbound service.

6. Created in ADT  a communication scenario and assign the outbound service to it. Chose the Authentication Methods Basic and X.509.

7.  Then in Communication Arrangements app created another communication arrangement based on our custom communication scenario, as well as a new communication system and an outbound communication user from step 1.

8.  Checked connection: we get "The ping of the outbound service was successful".

9. For the implementation of the outbound call, we used the code sample copied earlier from the service consumption model

I would really appreciate any help. Many thanks in advance for your help.

entry.title: Re: New Entries Not Available on Assign Warehouse Door
entry.content:
Hi Charisma,

here is the answer:

The creation of doors is described in

SAP Signavio Process Navigator/

Solution Scenario/

SAP Best Practices for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Solution Process

Warehouse Inbound Processing (3BR)

Set-Up Instructions

Define Warehouse Door.

https://pr.alm.me.sap.com/launchpad#processnavigator-display&/SolS/EARL_SolS-013/2508/SolP/3BR/?region=DE

 

Door-related steps are covered in solution process Warehouse Outbound Processing (3BS) within the Test script, sections 2.6.3‚Äì2.6.6:

  - 2.6.3 Create Loading Point (Optional)

  - 2.6.4 Assign Door to Loading Point (Optional)

  - 2.6.5 Staging Area and Door Determination (Outbound)

  - 2.6.6 Access Sequence to Staging Areas and Door Determination

- 3BS (Outbound) test script sections 2.6.3‚Äì2.6.6

  https://me.sap.com/processnavigator/SolS/EARL_SolS-013/2508/SolP/3BS?region=DE

Hope this helps.

entry.title: Building Resilient Enterprises: SAP‚Äôs Security Gains from Microsoft Defender for Cloud
entry.content:
By Sven Frank, Cyber Security Architect IAM & Zero Trust (SAP), Martin Pankraz, Principal Product Manager SAP Integration and Security (Microsoft), Amos Wendorff, Cyber Security Data Governance Lead

 

üö®The 3 PM Friday Security Crisis: Why Human-Centered Security Matters

Picture this: It's 3 PM on a Friday, and your development team just discovered a critical production issue affecting thousands of customers. A major client demo is scheduled for Monday morning, and your lead developer needs to spin up additional Azure resources immediately to implement a hotfix. The standard security approval process typically takes 48 hours.

‚ö†Ô∏èThe Dangerous Moment: In this high-pressure situation, it's tempting to take shortcuts‚Äîopening broader network access than necessary, using shared service accounts, or bypassing security scanning protocols. "We'll fix it properly after the crisis," becomes the dangerous refrain that can turn a temporary workaround into a permanent vulnerability.

üõ°Ô∏è The SAP Secure-by-Default Philosophy

At SAP, securing our Microsoft Azure landscapes extends beyond technology alone. We face tight deadlines and pressure to complete projects quickly, which can challenge maintaining strong security practices. That's why our secure-by-default approach‚Äîclosing unnecessary ports, phasing out legacy authentication, and enforcing automated policies with thorough identity management‚Äîis designed to support everyone in staying secure, even when time is limited.

‚ö°Speed AND Security, Not Speed OR Security

When our developer can provision resources through pre-configured, security-hardened templates with just a few clicks, we eliminate the false choice between speed and security. Equally important is fostering a security-conscious mindset throughout our teams, grounded in continuous learning and constructive accountability. Through consistent knowledge-sharing sessions, we ensure alignment across the organization.

üîóBridging Security and Architecture: A Real-World Challenge

But here's where it gets more complex. Fast-forward to Monday morning‚Äîthe crisis is resolved, but now our Enterprise Architecture team discovers something concerning. During the weekend sprint, three different teams independently deployed similar cloud applications to solve related problems. Each believed they were following secure practices, but collectively, they've created an unmanaged sprawl of SaaS applications across our landscape.

The traditional scenario: Our security team knows these applications exist and can assess their individual risk profiles through Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps. Meanwhile, our enterprise architects are mapping our application portfolio in SAP LeanIX, trying to understand capability gaps and technology dependencies. In most enterprises, IT security and enterprise architecture are two critical disciplines, each with their own priorities, tools, and perspectives. One is laser-focused on threat detection, compliance, and access control. The other is mapping capabilities, rationalizing applications, and shaping long-term IT strategy.
But what if these two worlds could work together seamlessly?

 

üéØThe Power of Integration: SAP #LeanIX + Microsoft Defender for Cloud App

At SAP, we've implemented an integration between SAP LeanIX and Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps that transforms how we approach secure and compliant software usage. With this integration, you can pull application usage and risk data from Defender for Cloud Apps directly into SAP LeanIX. That means: ... You're no longer just identifying what's out there - you're aligning it with your architecture strategy. This turns ad-hoc discovery into intentional governance.

üîçReal-Time Visibility Meets Strategic Planning

Applications are added to Cloud Apps in MS Defender when someone accesses a cloud application through their browser, which could lead to a significant number of discovered applications. This continuous discovery feeds directly into our LeanIX environment, where our enterprise architects can immediately see:

  • Risk-aligned Architecture Decisions: Security risk scores from Defender for Cloud Apps appear alongside capability mappings in LeanIX, enabling architects to make informed decisions about application rationalization
  • Compliance-Driven Portfolio Management: Applications flagged for compliance issues in Defender are automatically highlighted in our architecture views, allowing us to prioritize remediation based on business impact
  • Usage-Based Capability Planning: Real usage data helps identify which applications are truly critical versus those that can be consolidated or retired

üöÄFrom Reactive Discovery to Proactive Governance

This integration fosters collaboration between two personas that often operate in parallel but rarely intersect. With Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps and SAP LeanIX, they do - bringing security and architecture into a shared conversation around risk, capability, and value.

Kahoot is an example of an in-house approved application, in the terminology of Defender for Cloud Apps a sanctioned application. This allows the Enterprise Architect to make clear, data-driven decisions when harmonizing tools, eliminating guesswork and ensuring alignment across the organization.

If you want to learn more about LeanIX and Defender for Cloud Apps, have a look here.
This blog post was co-authored by @Michelle10 

 

üåäThe Ripple Effect of Integrated Security / Final Part

This comprehensive strategy enables us to effectively protect our environments and maintain the highest security standards across our SAP landscapes in Azure - even when the pressure is on.

Ultimately, our customers and partners benefit directly from these security practices, as they translate into more robust, reliable, and trustworthy SAP solutions. The secure-by-default principles and security-conscious culture that protect our Azure environments become foundational elements when organizations implement our products - creating a ripple effect that strengthens security across the broader ecosystem.

entry.title: S/4HANA Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM) and Situation Handling Scenarios: Part-1
entry.content:
In this blog, Part-1, I will be primarily focusing on SAP Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM) through a Supply Chain use case - predicting the forecast delivery date by using regression based predictive model (SAP Standard ISLM Framework). This Model provides predictions based on historical data. I will also touch base on the SAP Situation Handling Scenario for the Stock Transfer Order Process. However, I will walk you through the set-up in more detail in Part-2 of this blog series.

My Business Use Case:

My organization has to transfer an Asset: 20000000 (Equipment: 10000001-Air Compressor 1250 CFM 8KG/CM2) from our Norco Plant in Louisiana to our Robinson Plant in Illinois. To support this process and predict the forecast delivery date based on historical stock transfers, we have activated the ISLM Scenario: MATERIAL_OVERDUE_SIT (Stock In Transit Material Overdue) and a  Situation Handling Scenario: MAN_MATLOVERDUESITSITN (Stock Transport Order Overdue) to monitor exceptions as well.

Let us dive in...

What Is ISLM: Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management is a standardized framework to build and manage AI use cases within SAP S/4HANA for both embedded and side-by-side scenarios. It can be leveraged to perform lifecycle operations, including Scheduled Training and Retraining, and deployment of the model directly within SAP S/4HANA.

ISLM framework consists of two Fiori Applications, Intelligent Scenarios (App ID F4469) and Intelligent Scenario Management (App ID F4470). These two applications provide a unified interface for creating, deploying,  monitoring, and activation of the model directly within SAP S/4HANA.

Based on the ISLM association with business application, the ISLM scenarios can be categorized as Embedded and Side-by-Side.

Embedded: A business application, for example SAP S/4HANA runs in the same stack as its machine learning provider with the analytics libraries SAP HANA Automated Predictive Library (APL) or SAP HANA Predictive Analysis Library (PAL).

 Side-by-Side: A business application, for example SAP S/4HANA runs in a separate stack than its machine learning infrastructure provider.

 To begin with, let us take a look at the architecture of SAP Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management.

Architecture of Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management

  • Business User: The user who Interacts with the business application and uses the predictions from machine learning for the business purpose.
  • Business Administrator: A domain expert who can perform model trainings based on business context, evaluate model quality , and activate a model for production usage.
  • Technical Administrator: A system administrator who can perform the configurations of connectivity between different entities and maintains the technical configurations of the system.
  • ABAP Developer: A developer who can create ABAP artifacts required for Intelligent Scenario registration.
  • Intelligent Scenario Owner: An owner who creates, reviews, and publishes the Intelligent Scenario.

For instance, based on our business use case, I will walk you through the standard ISLM scenario that leverages one of the models from SAP HANA Automated Predictive Library (APL) by stepping into the roles of "Business User", "Business Administrator", and "Intelligent Scenario Owner".

The Intelligent Scenarios App is used to create, display, and configure various scenarios tailored to specific business needs. Using this App, we can view a list and activate SAP provided standard scenarios or create Embedded or Side-by-Side scenarios. 

Now, let us use the SAP provided ISLM scenario "MATERIAL_OVERDUE_SIT" and take a look at the input and out put fields used by the model, and Fiori App IDs that support the business process.

The Input fields are the data points to train an ML model and to make new prediction. They represent the historical business data and other relevant information that the ML model can learn from to identify the patterns.

Output fields contain the results generated by the ML model after it is trained. These output fields provide the predictions and related metrics back to the business application.

It`s time to publish the scenario...

After successfully publishing the ISLM scenario, let us move on to the "Intelligent Scenario Management" application to  train the model and schedule it.

The Intelligent Scenario Management App is used to manage, monitor,  and optimize AI driven scenarios throughout their entire lifecycle. We can view the list of App IDs relevant for the ISLM scenario MATERIAL_OVERDUE_SIT.

For instance, let us retrain the model with new historical data using new filtering conditions. The system generates a new Model Version ID for every "Retrain".

Following the successful training, the system provides a statistical information on variables and performance of the model. The model version report screen provides a summary about a particular model version. The quality information details varies according to the intelligent scenario type and underlying machine learning used.

For Instance, the following filter values are used for training the model.

The tab "Debrief" in a "Model Version Report" provides a breakdown of the trained machine learning model`s characteristics and its key influencing factors. The "Debrief" helps us understand and evaluate the model by explaining the main drivers behind its prediction.

Key Influencers and their percentage of contribution in the overall prediction.

We can schedule a training for our Intelligent Scenarios. When the schedule is created for a training, the system creates a planned task, which can be viewed in "Scheduled Planned Task" tab.

Mini Note: If we try to create a new schedule without deactivating the previous one, the system prompts an error message.

We can monitor the scheduled runs that are created via ISLM in the "Monitor Planned Task Jobs" tile.

We can copy and cancel the planned task and view the logs associated with each run of the schedule.

Now, let us move on to "Situation Handling Scenarios"...

As part of our business use case, I have activated the situation handling scenario with the following conditions: "MAN_MATLOVERDUESITSITN" to notify respective business team if the the order gets delayed.

Situation Handling Scenario: ZMAN_MATLOVERDUESITSITN conditions to trigger an exception message.

Situation Handling Conditions to trigger an exception notification...

Following the successful activation and training of ISLM and Situation Handling Scenarios, let us examine the transactional data.

Norco Plant asset/equipment master:

We have Asset Master and Equipment Master synchronization functionality in place. 

Following the successful movement of equipment 10000001 from its functional location to Engineering Spares Warehouse, the system updates the stock in the designated storage location, which should be transferred to the Robinson Plant.  The stock movement has been completed using a Maintenance Order.

Now, let us create a Stock Transfer Order using App ID F1957 - Transfer Stock Cross - Plant

With this App, we can make transfer postings from one plant(Issuing Plant) to another plant(Receiving Plant). This app supports warehouse clerk in finding the allowed transfer postings  and in personalizing the control settings of storage locations and visible columns.

For instance, I have chosen the material code "271", which is designated for Equipment 10000001.

Mini Note: If the predictive analytics model is active, the system uses the predicted delivery date as forecast delivery date. We can also select the entry "Use Predictive Model for Forecast Delivery Date" in the application settings.

I have chosen the storage location 171B , which contains the stock of Equipment 10000001. I have entered the input values in the pop-up screen. The activated ISLM scenario model determines the "Forecast Delivery Date" for the stock transfer order based on the historical data.

Now, let us create "Stock Transport Order" using the option "Create Stock Transport Order".

Following the successful creation of stock transport order,  using App ID F2139: Overdue Materials - Stock In Transit, we can view the "Predicted Deviation" values for the stock transport orders.

Using this App F2139 (Overdue Materials-Stock In Transit) with an Active Predictive Model:

  • If the predictive analytical model is active, the system uses the predicted delivery date as forecast delivery date.
  • If the predictive analytics model is active, we can select the "Predicted Deviation" field in the view settings for the results list.

Mini Note: The predicted deviation field displays the difference between the planned and the predicted delivery date. With this information about the predicted deviation, we get an impression that if a goods receipt can be successfully completed in time.

How to Interpret the predicted Deviation field value:

  • In our case, the predicted deviation for the STO 4500000334 is negative, i.e., -1  : This means that the forecast delivery date calculated by the predictive model is one day later than the planned delivery date from the purchase order.
  • If the predicted deviation is 0 (Zero) : This means that the forecast delivery date and the planned delivery date from the purchase order are the same.
  • If the predicted deviation is positive, for example 2 : This means that the forecast delivery date calculated by the predictive model is two days ahead of the planned delivery date from the purchase order.

Using this App F2139 (Overdue Materials-Stock In Transit) without an Active Predictive Model: 

  • If the predictive analytics model is not active, we cannot select the "Predicted Deviation" field in the view settings for the results list.
  • If the predictive analytics model is not active, the micro chart uses the planned delivery date from the purchase order instead.
  • If the predictive analytics model is not active, the forecast delivery date and the planned delivery date of the purchase order are the same.

The shipping duration micro chart illustrates the goods movement process for an Stock Transfer Order item and shows the forecast delivery date in relation to the actual delivery date. 

Since we have activated the "Situation Handling Scenario" with the conditions, the system triggers the exception notification when the stock in transit days are >1.

In our use case, the STO 4500000334 was delayed and met the conditions that are part of situation handling scenario; hence, the system triggered the exception notification.

The situations are displayed at "Bell Icon", which is a gate way to the SAP Fiori notification center.

or we can use "App ID: F4154 (My Situations app) " to monitor exception notifications.

Following the successful completion of the STO 4500000334, the situation can be closed using thee option "Close Situations" in My Situations App.

üòä This brings me to the end of a detailed walkthrough of the SAP Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management process , along with a high-level overview on how the situation handling scenario supports business teams in monitoring exceptions. I hope this blog proves useful to the Inventory Management team to have a nuanced understanding of material movements with enhanced predictive insights and exception notifications during Stock Transfer Order Process.

A detailed walkthrough of the SAP Situation Handling scenario process flow is covered in Part-2 of this blog series...use the link below to view it.

S/4HANA Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM) and Situation Handling Scenarios: Part-2 

--

Yours Sincerely,

Pardhasaradhi Reddy. C

entry.title: Configuring Employer Compliance Task for WTPA Forms
entry.content:
With the 2H 2025 release, SAP SuccessFactors is enhancing the Compliance framework with a new capability ‚Äî Employer Compliance Task ‚Äî designed to streamline how employee pay-specific compliance forms such as Wage Theft Prevention Act (WTPA) are handled during the onboarding process.

In the current (legacy) implementation, partners and customers are required to configure field-level override mappings and business rules for every individual form field. This not only increases setup effort but also requires ongoing maintenance whenever statutory formats evolve.

The newly introduced Employer Compliance Task significantly simplifies this process. It allows the employer or designated responsible user to directly enter employee-specific pay details inside the compliance form, as part of the standard onboarding flow ‚Äî eliminating the need for most manual override configurations.

This enhancement is initially available for:

  • üá∫üá∏WTPA New York and California forms

  • üáÆüá≥India EPF Declaration Form

  • üá®üá¶Canada TD1 Form

This blog provides implementation-focused guidance for implementation partners and SAP SuccessFactors consultants, covering feature activation, configuration steps, functional behavior changes, and flow comparison with the previous approach.

Prerequisites

  • Onboarding instance updated to 2H 2025 release
  • Compliance Framework enabled
  • WTPA forms (New York and/or California) are licensed and active
  • Admin access to Compliance Settings
  • At least one eligible Manager or Corp Representative user available to act as Employer
  • (Optional but recommended) Global Filter framework configured for assigning WTPA NY vs CA selectively

Why This New Method Is Valuable

Legacy Override Mapping

Employer Compliance Task (New)

Every field mapped manually via field override

Employer directly enters values inside Compliance UI

Business rules required for even simple values

Zero mapping required ‚Äî real-time user entry

No live control for HR before employee signature

Full employer validation first, before employee signs

Risky for fast-changing fields like wage & schedule

Ideal for dynamic compensation fields

Recommendation: If dynamic pay data is employer-known but not stored in EC ‚Üí use Employer Compliance Task.

Step 1: Enable Employer Compliance Task

Go to:
Admin Center ‚Üí Compliance Settings ‚Üí United States ‚Üí ‚ÄúNotice of Pay Rate ‚Äì Wage Theft Prevention Act (WTPA)‚Äù

  1. Expand the WTPA country group
  2. Click Add Configuration
  3. Enter Name, Description & designate Employer user selection

Enable both checkboxes:

  • ‚úÖEnable employer compliance task for filling and/or signing the compliance forms
  • ‚úÖEnable Employer Compliance Task for WTPA Form

Screenshot placeholder:

Eligible Employer Users

You may assign one of the following as Employer (responsible user):

  • Any Manager from Job Relationships (Manager, HR Manager, Second Manager, Matrix Manager, etc.)
  • Corp Representative (external ‚Äî must be resolved through a Business Rule)

Screenshot placeholder:

 

Step 2: Configure Global Filter for Form Assignment

Define which WTPA version (NY or CA) is assigned to which new hire based on legal entity, state, country, etc.

Refer Global FIlter Configuration link, for configuring filter configuration for WTPA form assignment.

Step-by-Step User Experience

Step 1 ‚Äî New Hire Task (No Change)

New hire opens compliance task ‚Üí selects Language Preference

 

Step 2 ‚Äî Employer Compliance Task (New!)

A new task is created for Employer to fill legally required wage & schedule details directly in the form.

Step 3 ‚Äî New Hire Signature

The generated PDF contains both New Hire and Employer-entered data.
New Hire reviews ‚Üí signs.

Step 4 ‚Äî Employer Signature (Only for California WTPA)

If WTPA CA ‚Üí Employer receives one final signature task

 

Key Differences vs Legacy Override Mapping

Aspect

Legacy Field Override

Employer Compliance Task

Configuration Effort

High ‚Äî mapping for each field

Low ‚Äî no mapping needed

Who enters data

System/business rule

Employer in UI

Flexibility

Needs code change for updates

Real-time

CA Employer Signature Support

‚ùåNo

‚úÖYes

Summary ‚Äî When to Use What

Scenario

Recommended Method

Static data from EC

Legacy Override Mapping

Dynamic pay/schedule admin-controlled

‚úÖEmployer Compliance Task (recommended)

California legal requirement with employer signature

‚úÖEmployer Compliance Task only

Closing Note for Partners

This new method significantly reduces implementation complexity and avoids maintenance-heavy field mapping logic ‚Äî especially for high-variance employer-entered wage details.

This Employer Compliance feature is going to be co-exist and supported along with existing fieldOverride mapping option.

entry.title: Objectives in SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager ‚Äî Part 1 on Driving Transformation
entry.content:
What is SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager

For customers
SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager is the central workspace for planning, steering, and proving the success of enterprise transformation programs. It links business objectives with the initiatives, tasks, and results that deliver them. By combining strategic goals with live process data and benchmarking analytics, it provides a single, transparent view of where change is happening and whether it is working.

For partners
SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager offers an integration and extension layer for partners who help customers design, implement, and monitor transformation programs. Its upcoming APIs will allow partners to connect external project-management systems and data platforms, and analytics tools, enabling automated synchronization of objectives, initiatives, and insights across ecosystems.

Why start with Objectives

When companies say ‚Äúwe‚Äôre transforming,‚Äù they often mean ‚Äúwe‚Äôre busy.‚Äù Objectives make you ask why you‚Äôre busy and how you‚Äôll know it worked. In SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager, an Objective represents a concrete business goal:
‚ÄúReduce order-to-cash cycle by 20%,‚Äù or ‚ÄúImprove on-time delivery to 98%.‚Äù

With the July 2025 release, SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager introduced first-class support for Objectives: you can now create, edit, assign owners, and link them directly to Initiatives, ensuring every action in your program serves a strategic purpose.

Objective Details Panel

How to Use Objectives in SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager

  1. Define clear, measurable goals ‚Äì Use SMART criteria. Keep the number manageable (3‚Äì5 strategic objectives).
  2. Create them in SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager ‚Äì Each objective has title, description, owner, timeline, and status.
  3. Link Initiatives ‚Äì Every project or program should trace back to at least one objective.
  4. Adapt ‚Äì Objectives evolve; SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager's structure makes it easy to update and re-align.

Objective Main Area View

Common Pitfalls

  • Too many objectives dilute focus.
  • Vague wording like ‚Äúimprove efficiency‚Äù without targets. 
  • Initiatives launched without objectives ‚Äî that‚Äôs not transformation, that‚Äôs motion.

Why it matters

Objectives are the spine of transformation. They bring clarity, alignment, and accountability. SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager gives you a way to define them once, link everything that happens in your organization to them, and track whether those activities deliver actual value.

Next in the series: Initiatives ‚Äî How to translate your objectives into executable programs with SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager.

entry.title: Where to begin with SAP Requirements in Jira?
entry.content:
I think all of SAP project experts will agree that SAP Requirements Management is much more than an Excel file downloaded from the SAP Activate Roadmap accelerators list and filled with unstructured notes from Fit-2-Standard workshops. In practice, Requirements Management should be the bridge between business intent and tested, working functionality. And yet, this bridge often does not exist. The disconnect between what business processes should do and what finally goes live remains one of the biggest causes of rework and missed value in SAP programs.

Why managing requirements is important?

A weak requirements discipline leads later to solution scope creep, fragmented testing, and the famous ‚Äúthis isn‚Äôt what we expected‚Äù moment during the UAT. Well organized requirements management turns conversations into commitments - every requirement becomes traceable from the "Need" through "Realize and Test" to "Deploy". Traceability is the essence of governance in SAP Activate.

High-level business outcomes are defined during Discover and Prepare phase, while detailed functional, non-functional, and delta requirements are refined and documented during the Explore phase. They are documented against SAP Best Practice processes (for example BD9 - Sell from Stock).

Every requirement should be linked to its related Test Case and Work Package to ensure full traceability from Fit-to-Standard through Deployment. This linkage keeps it transparent, testable, and aligned with business value.

How SAP Activate Defines a Requirement

In the Requirements-to-Deploy (R2D) framework, a requirement is a single, testable statement describing the system behavior or capability needed to fulfill a business need.
Each requirement should be:

  • Atomic ‚Äì one clear need, not a bundle of ideas.

  • Unambiguous ‚Äì can be interpreted only in one way.

  • Traceable ‚Äì linked to a Process, Scope Item and Work Package (deliverable).

  • Testable ‚Äì verifiable through objective criteria.

A requirement is not a meeting note like ‚ÄòNeed better reports‚Äô; it states precisely what the system must do. It defines what the system must achieve but not yet how to implement it.

When written in a standardized way, requirements become the shared language between Business and IT - the foundation for alignment, testing, and auditability.

 Practically in Jira

Ok, so if it is now clear what a requirement is and how it should be defined, the next question becomes where to manage all this effectively. That‚Äôs where Jira - when properly configured - becomes a practical backbone for collecting, tracking, and approving SAP requirements.

In Jira, requirements can be managed as custom Work Item types aligned with SAP Activate governance standards.

  1. Create a dedicated work item type called Requirement with a distinct icon.

  2. Configure essential fields and workflow statuses (e.g., Draft ‚Üí To Be Approved ‚Üí Approved ‚Üí In Realization ‚Üí Completed).

  3. Link each requirement to its Scope item, ensuring full traceability.

Once configured, you can collect requirements directly in Jira during your Fit-To-Standard workshops.

SAP native tools

While SAP Cloud ALM and Solution Manager‚Äôs Focused Build provide strong governance for requirement-to-deploy processes, many organizations still complement them with Jira to enable broader Agile methods delivery, integrate non-SAP workstreams, and leverage its native links with Confluence and Test automation tools. Also, there are a few integration tools available that allow for data exchange between Jira and SAP.

Your Goal

In any SAP project, your goal is to ensure that every piece of delivered and tested functionality traces back to at least one well-written requirement. However, the discipline lies not in the tool itself but in the governance structure and consistency with which it‚Äôs used.

If you have found this article informative, please leave me a Kudo on top of this page.
This will encourage me to write more articles in SAP Community. Thank you!

About author

Bogdan G√≥rka works as Atlassian Solution Architect and SAP Project Governance Consultant.
Creator of R2D ALM for Jira, independent Atlassian consultant, and founder of PMBG.EU.

entry.title: IDOC integration of SAP backends - SAP Cloud Integration (Int. Suite)
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We have an inbound IDOC interface using SAP Integration Suite(Cloud Integration) .. SOAP to IDOC is the scenario where sender is a web services.. Now, our Basis team is declining to enable SICF on SAP backend and adding "/" path as it is against our organization security hardening guidelines.. We are using Cloud Connector obviously.. below are the steps implemented :-

1. All communication will flow exclusively through the SAP Cloud Connector(SCC) , establishing a secure, avoiding direct internet exposure of the backend. Strict firewall rules maintained to allow only essential communication between the Cloud Connector and the SAP backend. All communication utilizes standard, auditable HTTPS/TLS 1.2+ protocols, securing data transmission end-to-end. The SCC configuration explicitly exposes only the virtual host and the single path: /sap/bc/srt/idoc.

2. Secure ICF Service Activation on SAP Backend : Only the specific /sap/bc/srt/idoc ICF service will be activated, with debugging/tracing disabled in production.. Debugging and tracing features are explicitly disabled on the SICF service in all Production environments.

3. A dedicated, non-dialog user is created with a single-purpose role ..

SAP Support documentation confirms that the use of the '/' value in S_SERVICE does not act as a security wildcard for explicitly defined Web Services. This guarantees that the technical user is strictly contained and cannot execute other general services. Please see below screenshot of email from SAP team regarding the same. Could you please add if anything important is missing here to establish secure architecture? Any chances that our Organization Hardening tam still rejects ?

Regards,

Ramu.

entry.title: What's New in SAP HANA Cockpit SP 18
entry.content:
SAP HANA cockpit SP 18 continues to advance database administration capabilities with enhancements in administration and monitoring, landscape management, advanced administration, and security & user management. The complete list of SAP HANA cockpit SP 18 features is available in the What‚Äôs New in the SAP HANA Cockpit 2.0 section of the SAP Help Portal. This blog post highlights and demonstrates the key new functionality delivered in this version of the SAP HANA cockpit.

 

Administration and Monitoring

Third Level Partitioning

The release of SAP HANA cockpit SP 18 introduces enhanced partitioning capabilities, allowing tables to be partitioned for up to three levels. Previously, table partitioning was limited to two levels. This new feature offers database administrators greater flexibility to manage large table structures and optimize query performance.

To implement a third level partition, the first two levels need to be set to RANGE to create distinct, non-overlapping segments based on ordered values such as dates and ID numbers. Please note that the third level partitioning is only available for monitored databases with SAP HANA 2.0 version SPS 08 or later.

To facilitate this, the Table Distributions and Table Partitions app have been updated. You can now edit the existing first and second level partition information before adding the third level.

 

Import and Export Configuration Templates

The ability to import and export instance configuration templates between different SAP HANA cockpit environments is now available, providing a simple method to move configuration templates between different SAP HANA cockpit installations. Previously configuration templates could not easily be replicated in a different cockpit environment. The import/export functionality allows administrators to test configuration templates in a test or QA landscape, and once everything works as expected, to easily transport those templates to a production landscape.

In the Configuration Templates app in the Cockpit Manager, upon clicking on export, a .zip file containing the chosen template configurations in a .csv file will be downloaded.

When importing Template configurations, there are three options to choose from depending on your needs and if there are duplicate .

  • Do not import the file: if the uploaded .zip file contains any one duplicate template names, then it will cancel the import action for the entire .zip file
  • Only import templates that are not duplicates: the duplicate templates will be ignored, and it will only import the templates that are not duplicates
  • Import the file, overwrite duplicate templates: overwrite the duplicate templates, always importing the uploaded templates. It will delete the old duplicates and import the new templates.

Below is a screenshot of the options. 

This feature will be useful for database administrators who have a distribution of two separate cockpits for non-production and production SAP HANA databases. Now, you can easily manage the SAP HANA database parameters across the landscapes, streamlining your operations with SAP HANA cockpit SP 18.

Additional Statuses in Database Directory

Additional status filters to the Database directory app have been added for you to easily filter for a specific problem. The ‚ÄúRunning with Issues‚Äù status category used to group together several distinct problems, which are now broken down further. This status will be branched into 6 more specific ones, including, ‚ÄúInvalid Technical User‚Äù, ‚ÄúLicense Expired‚Äù, ‚ÄúNo SQL Access‚Äù, ‚ÄúSSL Enforced‚Äù, ‚ÄúTransitioning‚Äù, and ‚ÄúError‚Äù, as shown in the screenshot below.

This product enhancement provides more transparency and visibility, eliminating the troubleshooting process of finding the types of issues impacting each database instance. You can spend less time on diagnosing the root cause and filter for a specific problem to focus on the resolution of the critical issues.

SQL Statement Hints

We are introducing a more flexible and convenient way for you to manage your SQL statements using the Statement Hints app. Now when adding a new statement hint, you will be presented with three options for identifying the target SQL statement. In addition to the previous method of entering the full statement text, you can now directly provide the statements hash.

The new ‚ÄúSelect SQL Statement‚Äù option allows you to browse or search for previously run SQL statements in the database. You can view the actual SQL text and the statement hash, making it easier for you to locate the exact query to be tuned.

Statement Hints are now more helpful and efficient for database administrators, as these new capabilities allow for expensive SQL statements to more easily be identified and tuned.

 

Native Storage Extension (NSE), Buffer Cache Monitor Unload Threshold Parameter Configuration

Now, there is a more intelligent way to control and manage the SAP HANA Native Storage Extension (NSE) buffer cache. You can configure the unload threshold parameter to be automatically adjusted or still set it to a manual configured value. The automatic adjustment option allows for the system to dynamically calculate the optimal unload threshold value based on your databases workload. It can be configured to be adjusted in specified set time interval which depends on your landscape.

This automatically updating threshold value will be displayed directly on the Buffer Cache size chart for clear visibility.

Previously, the unload threshold was frequently set to the maximum size of the buffer cache based on the initial use of NSE tables. This caused a redundancy when NSE table sizes decrease, where a large amount of memory is being reserved for buffer cache that won‚Äôt be used. Now, the SAP HANA system can be configured to intelligently release unused portions of the buffer cache, translating to a more efficient utilization of the landscape. Note that this feature requires an SAP HANA 2.0 SPS 07 or newer registered database.

 

Native Storage Extension Advisor Configuration Improvements

The SAP HANA Native Storage Extension (NSE) Advisor has been enhanced by allowing its configuration to be changed with using a , called CS_NSE_ADVISOR. Now when opening the NSE Advisor configuration, a check occurs if the CS_NSE_ADVISOR procedure is running in the background. If it isn‚Äôt, you will be able to fill in the parameters in the config page. Below is a screenshot of the built-in procedure running with the parameters filled in.

Secondly there is now a way to automatically apply advice mode rules within the NSE Advisor config page, such as changing objects from cold column partitions to page loadable to reduce the memory footprint.

It provides a way for simple and routine NSE tasks to be automatically applied and is especially useful for data that is infrequently queried. These changes allow for a more efficient use of the NSE Advisor and gives you more control.

 

User Management and Security Administration

Support of JWT and X.509 Authentication

There is now more flexibility in the way you securely connect to your managed SAP HANA database with the new support for additional modern authentication methods. You can now sign in with JWT Single Sign-on (SSO), a JWT token or using an X.509 certificate in addition to the previous username and password method. To support these changes, an updated credential dialog with the three options makes it easy to select your desired authentication method. For the JWT Token, you can either use the enabled JWT SSO or use a different JWT token.

To provide clarity, the cockpit interface will always let you know of your current signed in authentication method for each database instance. You are always able to choose a new authentication method for that instance as well, by clicking on ‚ÄúChoose Authentication‚Äù.

 

String of Valid Origins when Configuring SSO

In SAP HANA Cockpit Manager, when an administrator enables JWT SSO for an SAP HANA database, they will see a new, optional field in the configuration dialog. This provides an additional option for enhanced security by specifying a list of trusted identity providers (IdPs) from where the authentication token will be accepted. With this new feature, you can enforce a policy so only users who have authenticated to the cockpit through a specific identify provider can use SSO to access the SAP HANA database.

 

Conclusion

We hope this blog post has given you a helpful overview of the key new functionality released in SAP HANA cockpit SP 18. With enhancements in administration and monitoring, landscape management, advanced administration and security & user management, we hope that you can leverage these new functionalities in your daily operational activities. For further information on all new features, please visit the What‚Äôs New in the SAP HANA Cockpit 2.0 section of the SAP Help Portal. You can visit the SAP help portal for more information about the SAP HANA cockpit.

entry.content:
Hi Team

 

 

 

Required the Dashboard for the approval pending PR and PO based on the created by with respective authorization.

 

 

 

PO creator:

 

1. PRs which are currently pending to be converted to POs. ‚Äì Live data

 

2. POs which are currently pending to be approved. ‚Äì Live data

 

3. Based on various fields like date selection, cost centre, material code: - History data

 

a. Number of POs created.

 

b. Value of POs created.

 

c. TAT for conversion of PR to PO

 

PO approver:

 

1. Pending approvals ‚Äì Live data

 

2. Approved POs ‚Äì History data

 

3. Number of approved and rejected purchase orders. ‚Äì History data

 

4. Based on various fields like date selection, cost centre, material code, vendor code: - History data

 

a. Number of POs created.

 

b. Value of POs created.

 

c. TAT for conversion of PR to PO

 

d. TAT for approval/ rejection of PO

 

5. Spend analysis

 

a. Material code wise spend

 

b. Cost centre wise spend

 

c. Top 5 or 10 vendor wise spends

 

PR creator and approver:

 

1. Based on various fields like date selection, cost centre, material code, vendor code: ‚Äì History data

 

a. No. of PRs created

 

b. Value of PRs created

 

c. TAT for conversion of PR creation to PR approval

 

2. Current status of PR to PO conversion ‚Äì Live data

 

3. Respective PO approval status against those POs ‚Äì Live data

 

 

 

Regards

entry.title: Re: DASHBOARD - PENDING FOR APPROVAL PR & PO
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

We have checked and can confirm that the following KBAs are related to your requirement for displaying pending approvals and approver details for PRs and POs:

  • KBA 3213204 ‚Äì Explains how to extract workflow approval data for Purchase Requisitions, Purchase Orders, and Supplier Invoices using CDS views (I_WorkflowStatusOverview, I_WorkflowStatusDetails, I_WorkflowRecipients_V2) and link them with PR/PO tables for reporting.

  • KBA 3633035 ‚Äì Provides steps to create a custom analytical report or Fiori app to display the list of PRs pending approval along with approver details by using Custom CDS Views and Analytical Queries.

Both KBAs complement each other:
KBA 3213204 covers the technical data extraction for workflows, while 3633035 guides on how to build and expose the custom app or report for end users.

We recommend following both KBAs together to fulfill your dashboard/reporting requirement in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

References:
3213204 - Workflow data details for Purchase Orders, Purchase Requisitions, Supplier Invoice
3633035 - App to Display List of Approvers for Purchase Requisitions in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

I hope this helps.

 

Regards

Aishwarya

OK, I did it!
The problem is that to connect with Designer, you MUST BE ABLE TO RESOLVE the IP address of the server into a hostname.
DNS or the HOSTS FILE are fine, but the client PC must be able to do it.
If a DNS is not available, YOU MUST put an entry in file hosts. AFTER you've populated your hosts file, you'll be able to log in to Designer, EVEN via IP.
